page.title: 16BLACKPOOL ILLUMINATIONS
page.content: Each year, thousands of people flock to Blackpool to see the illuminations along the promenade.This spectacle lasts for two months, (September and October)and is a great boost to the tourist industry. On the North Shore area is a long stretch of special tableaux in lights. This year, the most impressive was Postman Pat, a popular cartoon character; there were also pictures of nursery rhymes,4 metres high, showing Humpty Dumpty, Mary, Mary Quite Contrary and others, all in a multitude of flashing colours. Another popular tableau is Doctor Who and the Daleks; there are Star Wars and robots, too. As well as the stationary tableaux, there are several decorated trams, which are shaped like rockets, trains and boats and have coloured lights all over them
